jsat.clustering

Interface KClusterer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Clusterer, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CLARA, DivisiveGlobalClusterer, DivisiveLocalClusterer, EMGaussianMixture, KClustererBase, KMeans, MiniBatchKMeans, NaiveKMeans, PAM, PriorityHAC, SimpleHAC

    public interface KClusterer
extends Clusterer
    Defines a clustering method that requires the number of clusters in the data set to be known before hand.

    • Method Detail

      • cluster

        java.util.List<java.util.List<DataPoint>> cluster(DataSet dataSet,
                                                int clusters,
                                                java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService threadpool)
        Performs clustering on the given data set.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - the data points to perform clustering on
        clusters - the number of clusters to assume
        threadpool - a source of threads to run tasks
        Returns:
        A list of DataSets, where each DataSet contains the data points for one cluster in the group

      • cluster

        int[] cluster(DataSet dataSet,
            int clusters,
            java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService threadpool,
            int[] designations)

        Parameters:
        dataSet - the data points to perform clustering on
        clusters - the number of clusters to assume

      • cluster

        java.util.List<java.util.List<DataPoint>> cluster(DataSet dataSet,
                                                int lowK,
                                                int highK,
                                                java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService threadpool)
        Performs clustering on the given data set. The implementation will attempt to determine the best number of clusters for the given data.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - the data points to perform clustering on
        lowK - the lower bound, inclusive, of the range to search
        highK - the upper bound, inclusive, of the range to search
        threadpool - a source of threads to run tasks
        Returns:
        A list of DataSets, where each DataSet contains the data points for one cluster in the group

      • cluster

        int[] cluster(DataSet dataSet,
            int lowK,
            int highK,
            java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService threadpool,
            int[] designations)

      • cluster

        java.util.List<java.util.List<DataPoint>> cluster(DataSet dataSet,
                                                int lowK,
                                                int highK)
        Performs clustering on the given data set. The implementation will attempt to determine the best number of clusters for the given data.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - the data points to perform clustering on
        lowK - the lower bound, inclusive, of the range to search
        highK - the upper bound, inclusive, of the range to search
        Returns:
        A list of DataSets, where each DataSet contains the data points for one cluster in the group
